question: In which nation the "Old City of Dubrovnik", a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is located?
explanation: The Old City of Dubrovnik is a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in Croatia. It is known as the "Pearl of Adriatic" located on the Dalmatian Coast of Croatia facing the Adriatic Sea. It was an important Mediterranean sea power from the 13th century onwards. It is featured by Gothic Renaissance and Baroque churches, monasteries, palaces and fountains.
